Package ui

Class Connect4GUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • ui.Connect4GUI
  • public class Connect4GUI
extends javafx.application.Application
    Connect4GUI class provides a graphical user interface for Connect4 that communicates with a server for gameplay.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class javafx.application.Application

    • Constructor Detail

      • Connect4GUI

        public Connect4GUI​(java.net.Socket socket,
                   java.io.ObjectOutputStream out,
                   java.io.ObjectInputStream in)
        Constructor to initialize the Connect4 GUI with an existing server connection.
        Parameters:
        socket - The socket connected to the server.
        out - The output stream for sending data to the server.
        in - The input stream for receiving data from the server.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start​(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
        Initializes and displays the graphical user interface (GUI) for the Connect 4 game. The GUI consists of the game board, status indicators, and controls for submitting player moves. Handles server communication in a separate thread and updates the game board and status dynamically.
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application
        Parameters:
        primaryStage - The main stage used to host the Connect 4 GUI.

      • createBoard

        private javafx.scene.layout.GridPane createBoard()
        Creates the Connect4 game board using JavaFX.
        Returns:
        A GridPane containing the game board.

      • createUserInputBox

        private javafx.scene.layout.HBox createUserInputBox()
        Creates a user input box with a text field for column input.
        Returns:
        An HBox containing the input field and submit button.

      • submitMove

        private void submitMove​(int column)
        Submits the player's move to the server for the chosen column.
        Parameters:
        column - The column the player chose (1-based).

      • listenToServer

        private void listenToServer()
        Listens for messages from the server in a separate thread.

        Displays a prompt asking the user whether they want to replay or exit the game.

      • sendReplayResponseToServer

        private void sendReplayResponseToServer​(java.lang.String response)
        Sends the user's replay response to the server.
        Parameters:
        response - The user's replay response ("Yes" or "No").

      • resetGame

        private void resetGame()
        Resets the game state and UI.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
